# Chord: Minor 7th in A# (Shape: G)

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: A# (A sharp)
- Minor 3rd: C#
- Perfect 5th: F
- Minor 7th: G#

## Musical Flavor and Usage
The Minor 7th chord in A# (G shape) has a dark and moody feel due to the minor tonality and the added tension of the 7th. It is commonly used in jazz, R&B, funk, and soul music to create a mellow yet expressive atmosphere. This chord provides a sense of sophistication and adds depth to harmonic progressions.

## Songs
1. **"Summertime" by George Gershwin**: This jazz standard features the Minor 7th chord in various sections, adding a bluesy and melancholic touch to the progression.
   
2. **"So Into You" by Tamia**: In this R&B ballad, the Minor 7th chord in A# (G shape) is used to enhance the smooth and soulful vibe of the song.
   
3. **"Pick Up the Pieces" by Average White Band**: This funk classic prominently showcases the Minor 7th chord, contributing to the groovy and infectious feel of the track.
